title: A look at how we're building more sustainable hardware - The Keyword | Google Product and Technology News
summary: The article discusses the company's efforts to increase the use of recycled materials in their products, providing new repair options for customers, and improving their packaging by reducing plastic usage.
green_innovation: TRUE. The company's initiatives towards using recycled materials, providing repair options, and reducing plastic usage in packaging align with green innovation by contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. The introduction of new repair options for customers and efforts to improve packaging by reducing plastic usage represent business innovation within the company's product offerings.
green_product: TRUE. The focus on using recycled materials, reducing the carbon footprint, and eliminating plastic in packaging align with the characteristics of a green product, designed to reduce environmental impact throughout the product's life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. The company's initiatives towards using recycled materials and improving packaging by eliminating plastic demonstrate green processes that aim to minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 334290 - Other Communications Equipment Manufacturing, 334510 - Electromedical and Electrotherapeutic Apparatus Manufacturing, 421430 - Computer and Computer Peripheral Equipment and Software Merchant Wholesalers, 517919 - All Other Telecommunications
greenwashing: FALSE. The company's efforts seem genuine and aligned with environmental goals, without any indication of false or misleading claims.

title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: The article discusses the benefits of recycling in reducing waste, saving resources, creating jobs, and protecting the environment.
green_innovation: FALSE: While the article highlights environmental benefits and sustainability, it primarily focuses on the practice of recycling rather than introducing significant new innovations to address environmental challenges.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article focuses on the practice of recycling and its benefits but does not introduce new or significantly improved products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE: The article extensively discusses the concept and benefits of recycling, highlighting how it reduces environmental impact, conserves resources, and supports ecological and social benefits.
green_process: TRUE: The article emphasizes the importance of recycling as a method to minimize environmental impacts, conserve resources, reduce waste, and promote sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 562920 – Materials Recovery Facilities, 562111 – Solid Waste Collection, 562112 – Hazardous Waste Collection, 562119 – Other Waste Collection
greenwashing: FALSE: The article provides factual information about the benefits of recycling without making exaggerated or misleading claims, therefore not fitting the definition of greenwashing.

title: BRIDGESTONE DEVELOPS TIRE USING 75% RECYCLED AND RENEWABLE MATERIALS INCLUDING RECYCLED ... - PR Newswire
summary: Bridgestone produces tires with high recycled and renewable materials to advance sustainability goals and plans to utilize 100% sustainable materials by 2050.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as Bridgestone is developing tires with recycled and renewable materials to reduce its environmental impact and contribute to sustainability goals.
business_innovation: TRUE. This is a business innovation as Bridgestone is introducing new tires made with a significant portion of recycled and renewable materials, differing from its previous products.
green_product: TRUE. This is a green product as Bridgestone is designing tires that significantly reduce environmental impact by incorporating recycled and renewable materials throughout their life cycle.
green_process: TRUE. This is a green process as Bridgestone is utilizing methods to manufacture tires that minimize environmental impacts by using recycled and renewable materials, and promoting sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 326211 - Tire Manufacturing, 326212 - Tire Retreading, 325110 - Petrochemical Manufacturing, 325510 - Paint and Coating Manufacturing
greenwashing: FALSE. This is not an example of greenwashing as Bridgestone is transparent about the materials used in the tires and their sustainability goals.

title: Setting Buy Clean Standards to Green US Steel - Rocky Mountain Institute
summary: The article discusses the importance of Buy Clean standards in green steel production and the role of US primary steel producers in decarbonization efforts.
green_innovation: TRUE. This article discusses Buy Clean standards aimed at reducing emissions in steel production, contributing to environmental sustainability goals.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article focuses on environmental standards in steel production rather than new products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE. The article highlights the importance of using environmentally friendly materials and sustainable processes in steel production, aligning with the definition of green products.
green_process: TRUE. The article emphasizes the importance of minimizing environmental impacts and promoting sustainability in steel manufacturing processes, aligning with the definition of green processes.
likely_naics_codes: Likely NAICS Codes: 331110 - Iron and Steel Mills and Ferroalloy Manufacturing, 331210 - Iron and Steel Pipe and Tube Manufacturing from Purchased Steel, 331111 - Iron and Steel Mills, 332312 - Fabricated Structural Metal Manufacturing
